byline.contributor: David E. Sanger and Michael R. Gordon contributed reporting.
byline.original: By CARL HULSE and DAVID M. HERSZENHORN

abstract: Pres Obama's success in gaining enough votes to put Iran nuclear agreement into place is in part due to coordinated endorsement and publicity campaign by White House and Congressional Democrats; organized strategy was aimed at beating back Republican opposition by securing loyalties of Democratic lawmakers.
lead_paragraph: A message from five world powers helped persuade many Democrats to back the accord, for which President Obama now has enough votes to survive Republican opposition.

headline.main: Coordinated Strategy Brings Obama Victory on Iran Nuclear Deal
headline.print_headline: A Coordinated Strategy Brings Victory to Obama on the Iran Nuclear Deal

snippet: A message from five world powers helped persuade many Democrats to back the accord, for which President Obama now has enough votes to survive Republican opposition.
